title: Account lost?
content: I have been using Thunderbird for years, but now when I start Thunderbird it thinks I am a new user to set up a new account. It does not find my existing email files. I think all my email files might be saved in the "profiles" folder. ( If not, I have it backed up.) How do I get Thunderbird to use my existing account and email files?
creator: tigergary

title: Email Body only contains numbers since update
content:
Since the latest update a lot of my emails are coming in to my inbox with only numbers in the body of the message ie.

=_Part_4227871_1899405150.1549487886647--

Also with: No from No subject

This particular message is from news .com . au

I tried closing and opening the program but messages like this remain the same

Help!

TIA
creator: clancampbell2

title: Thunderbird email
content:
Sometimes when my email is downloading from my server (Spectrum) to Thunderbird, I receive the following gibberish when I open the messages:

--_004_SA9PR09MB6013C660D2A52C8FB341066A8A4D9SA9PR09MB6013namp_--

I have tried rebooting, but the same thing happens. It is not a persistent problem, but enough to be annoying and I have lost the email content. Thanks

Peter
creator: brecca

title: Unauthorized password change
content:
OK, suddenly I cannot log into Thunderbird with my email password. Luckily I also have a Google Business account with that same email address, which DID allow me to log in with the same password Thunderbird is disallowing.

I have been logging into both Thunderbird and Google Mail for months now with no problem, but this cropped up tonight.

Is this something that has happened tonight to Thunderbird and its relationship to IMAP servers?

And, yes, sure I can get into my email through Google Mail, but I prefer going to it via an offline client when possible.
creator: beirdd

title: I cannot see my email inbox messages
content:
My Mozilla inbox email is empty after restoring folders. How do I restore all my saved messages or even receive new ones.

Thanks, Sandie
creator: rscarrico

title: Thunderbird Events - Organizer has default domain of @internal
content:
When I create a new event by right-clicking on a day on the monthly calendar and then "Invite Attendees" I see in the new pop-up dialog that the organizer of the event has the illegal domain address of "@internal". The attendees receive their invitations but the .ics contains the line

ORGANIZER;PARTSTAT=NEEDS-ACTION;CUTYPE=INDIVIDUAL;SENT-BY="mailto: 

<redacted>":mailto:<redacted>@internal

Since <redacted>@internal is an illegal email address the attendee cannot respond to the invitation either in the affirmative or negative.

How can I change the default domain of the organizer to the email address of the user creating the event? I have searched through all the settings I can find no mention of @internal there or in the documentation on the web.

I have been testing on my Win 8.1 system and Thunderbird 115.16.2 (32-bit), which is the most advanced available. The people I work with experience the same behavior with Thunderbird 128.3.0 on Win 10 and Win 11.
creator: det1059

title: Why doesn't Thunderbird search for emails?
content: Why doesn't such a simple function in the program work? It's always like this, not for some time. Sometimes it finds some emails, sometimes it doesn't. It doesn't matter if I enter an email address or part of a word from the email.
creator: allegro.kosta

title: New emails in inbox blank
content:
I've been using Thunderbird for many years, and have always been very happy with it. I have it linked to my Google Mail account.

In the last couple of months, however, an issue has begun where at least 1, more usually whole batches of new emails in my inbox, are blank with a LinkedIn logo, both in the preview window, or if I open it in a new tab. Nothing seems to make it readable, I have to open my browser to view the emails, but it's never all the new emails, just some of them. Anybody had the same issue and fix?
creator: charles.kent

title: Passare una cartella locale su Thunderbird da un pc ad un altro
content:
Sto passando Thunderbird da un PC ad un altro. Dopo l'installazione dell'app non ho avuto problemi con il passaggio dell'account on line copiando la cartella.

Non riesco invece a trasferire della posta archiviata e salvata in locale su una cartella del disco.

Non posso riportare tutto nella caselle di posta per limite di spazio disponibile.

Allego immagine della path della cartella locale.

Vi chiedo come posso importare una cartella locale da disco a disco?

Grazie per l'aiuto che potrete darmi

Gianni
creator: degerolamog

title: CARTELLE
content: Buongiorno, per comodità, ho creato nella colonna a sinistra del menu nelle cartelle locali, posta in arrivo uscita ecc, una serie di cartelle suddivise per cliente in modo da conservare la mail ognuna per cliente e ricercarle in maniera più facile e suddivisa. Devo però scorrerle tutte per trovare quella che mi serve. C'è un modo per chiamare la solo la cartella interessata. Allego screen Grazie
creator: amministrazione76

title: mon adresse principale ne s'installe pas sur thunderbird
content: mon adresse principale ne s'installe pas alors que les autres s'installent sans problèmes (adresses sur free et la poste)
creator: annie06810

title: windows 7 will not run
content: I'm a programmer. I have my main reliable box is windows 7. I'm committed to moving main linux (mint) and Raspberry. I have my other boxes and sbc's running fine. I installed and have installed linux on a laptop and the Thunderbird running on it. I don't know but suspect that running the last version (115) that supports win 7 and it somehow has quit working. It works fine on the laptop but I'm worried that either the "upgrade sync" has somehow not recognized that it was running on the windows 7 and it bumped / prepped the windows ??? I noticed that it just started saying on the latest version that it requires windows 10. I don't want to give in and update windows. It's trash - windows 10 & 11 are crap and have become to intrusive. Help with Thunderbird on my old windows 7 please  ! ! !
creator: bradhillyard

title: no puedo visualizar correctamente los mails
content: desde hace unos días, al usar thunderbird, al abrir ciertos correos no puedo visualizarlos...salen como codificados. ¿De que puede ser? ¿Alguna solución? Si uso el webmail del proveedor del dominio, los visualizo correctamente, pero thunderbird resulta mucho más cómodo para el manejo a diario. Gracias.
creator: marcosfazer
